page.title: 07ARUN CANAL; BRIDGES, LOCKS.
page.content: The Wey and Arun Canal Trust aims to restore the canal for navigation by small craft. Cooks bridge was restored some years ago. Work is in progress at two other sites on this stretch. The old bridge at Toat is a typical canal bridge but farm traffic used a track across the canal bed upstream. Trust volunteers, aided by the Manpower Services Commission, have built a new bridge,with sufficient headroom for boats, in place of the track: and a new spillway to allow surplus water to drain to the river. A mile to the north are the remains of Middle or Lee Farm lock. Nearby,a stream drained across the canal bed to the river. The Trust are in process of constructing a 100 feet long concrete culvert for this stream which will then run under the canal bed.
